The '''Nexus''', '''Nexus brand''' or '''Nexus family''' is a series of [[Android (operating system)|Android]] smartphones produced by [[Google]] in co-operation with selected hardware companies. The purpose of the Nexus phones is to offer a "pure Android experience", where the phones come free of carrier or manufacturer modifications and with an unlockable bootloader<ref>{{cite web|last=Bray |first=Tim |url=http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/12/its-not-rooting-its-openness.html |title=Android Developers Blog: Itâs not ârootingâ, itâs openness |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref> Nexus phones are considered the "flagship" Android devices.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://lifehacker.com/5707214/google-launches-android-23-gingerbread-and-nexus-s-flagship-phone |title=Google Launches Android 2.3 Gingerbread and Nexus S Flagship Phone |publisher=Lifehacker.com |date=2010-12-06 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=erica ho and brent rose The '''Nexus''' is a series of [[Android (operating system)|Android]] smartphones produced by [[Google]] in co-operation with selected hardware companies. The purpose of the Nexus phones is to offer a "pure Android experience", where the phones come free of carrier or manufacturer modifications and with an unlockable bootloader<ref>{{cite web|last=Bray |first=Tim |url=http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/12/its-not-rooting-its-openness.html |title=Android Developers Blog: Itâs not ârootingâ, itâs openness |publisher=Android-developers.blogspot.com |date=2010-12-20 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref> to allow for further development and end-user modification.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/03/galaxy-nexus-gets-rooted-forums-burst-into-applause/ |title=Galaxy Nexus gets rooted, forums burst into applause |publisher=Engadget |date=2011-11-03 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref> Nexus phones are considered the "flagship" Android devices.<ref>{{cite |publisher=Lifehacker.com |date=2010-12-06 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=erica ho and brent rose |publisher=Gizmodo.com |date=2011-10-18 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zdnet.com/blog/mobile-news/dont-diss-my-phone-nexus-s-to-get-ice-cream-sandwich-within-weeks/5214 |title=Donât diss my phone: Nexus S to get Ice Cream Sandwich within weeks |publisher=ZDNet |date=2011-10-27 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2010/11/11/exclusive-samsung-flagship-phone-with-gingerbread-and-huge-di/ |title=Exclusive: Samsung 'flagship' phone with Gingerbread and huge display coming in early *The [[Nexus One]] was manufactured by [[HTC]] and released in January 2010.
